passages.text: F2Q26 Quick Take + Callback Color Winds of Change but Burden of Consistency Remains

Broad- based demand strength (across new logos, expansions, healthy emerging products bookings) delivered record \(\) 53M\(F2Q NNARR producing a \~ 2% ARR beat - nice reprieve from \~ 2 years of - in - line performance - indicating recent GTM transformation/execution efforts focused on platform - selling are materializing. While this, coupled with new GTM initiatives (like Flex buying akin to peers' "buffet - style" programs) and acquisitions (Prompt) enhance F2H NNARR trajectory and prospects for FY26E NNARR to reach FY25 levels, limited P&L flow- through (F2Q26 revs in - line, FCF missed) and meek guidance upside/lift perplexes, disrupting ARR - to - rev convergence. Indeed, S cleared a low hurdle (F2Q26 NNARR implied guide of - 15% YoY) against trough sentiment with improving portfolio momentum. But the revamped GTM engine must still notch more points on execution consistency within highly competitive end markets to merit a durable valuation re- rating, in our view. Taken with RPO decel and mixed - bag guide (revs appear overly cautious against NNARR momentum), we stay Neutral.
Highlights from CEO, CFO callback -

1) Focused on driving both endpoint and emerging product growth vectors - Overall bookings are split 50%/50%, and mgmt sees more room to grow in the endpoint market while also accelerating emerging products. For endpoint, S is well-positioned to displace market share as \(\sim 50\%\) of the market is still held by incumbents and largely consists of the long tail of customers. Here, S is not seeing next-gen competitors have much success (and instead ceding share).

2) Winning competitively on multiple fronts - S is beating competitors across its product areas (e.g. SIEM, Cloud) and mgmt isn't seeing much competition on AI. There has been some reputational benefit related to CRWD's IT outage last year, but this is at the higher end of the market.

3) Purple AI is a strong source of competitive differentiation, with more capabilities to come that will embolden this - Purple AI is resonating well with customers as customers realize immediate value and the feature works across their enterprise data. However, these are still just "base" capabilities and there are significant developments to come that will alter how customers deploy AI for security. For instance, S is working to deliver an autonomous AI security platform that would outperform the currently nascent "AI SOC" space which involves hundreds of startups deploying use cases on top of platforms like S and its peers. Mgmt believes this is

something close competitors are taking note of and attempting to respond to (anecdotally some existing customers on next-gen peer platforms do recognize S's relative technological leadership but lack urgency to displace since nothing has 'broken' yet).
4) 8-figure Flex deal was an existing customer about to do a major expansion (not tied specifically tied to renewal), which S folded into the Flex structure that the customer was very receptive to.
5) F2Q had some deals that slipped from F1Q but overall outperformance driver was the broad-based strength and strong execution.

6) Insights into vertical growth – Purple AI is the fastest growing at triple digits while data is seeing faster growth than Cloud. Endpoint is also outgrowing the market (recall this accelerated in F2Q).

7) F2Q FCF misses Street but lands – in-line with internal expectations – Timing of collections was a factor here. Going into FY26E, mgmt expects a F4Q inflection against the F2H margin expansion and timing of collections.
8) FY26E OPM would have been raised if not for the \(\sim 180\) bpts headwind in the balance of the year.

9) Endpoint will remain relevant in an increasingly SaaS/Al world – as mgmt articulated an effective secure browser requires secure endpoint given its interconnectedness. Moreover, the browser market is becoming increasingly fragmented where incumbents (e.g. Chrome) become more “enterprise” and as AI-companies/startups move-in. Net, this requires more security injected into the browser and where mgmt believes they are well-positioned to do so, particularly with the acquisition of Prompt. Meanwhile, GenAI usage is also a mix of browser and the endpoint SW.

We apply a growth- adjusted EV/S ratio to our forecasts to yield our price target, given S's \(>20\%\) topline growth levels. We adjust this ratio vs. current levels to account for qualitative factors such as quality / consistency of sales execution, competitive positioning, and profitability expansion ("Rule of 40" benchmark).

Our \(\) 19\$ price target is based on \(\sim 0.3x\) EV/S/G ratio on our CY25- CY28E revenue CAGR of \(\sim 19\%\) , which implies a \(\sim 5x\) exit multiple. We apply this \(\sim 5x\) target multiple on our CY28E revenue estimates, and discount back to CY24E at \(10\%\) to yield this 12- month price target. Our target ratio is a premium to the current CY24- 26E based EV/S/G ratio to reflect better profitability profile and share gain optionality from the CRWD outage. This ratio is at a discount to Cloud- native security peers as cash burn and decelerating topline growth produce a \(\sim 30\%\) "Rule of 40" in FY26(CY25), below this cohort, yet S is unlikely to achieve break- even profitability until FY26 (CY25). This, along with execution credibility and potentially more aggressive competitive behavior from Microsoft elevates the risk of a sharper growth deceleration supports our view.

We rate S High Risk based upon our quantitative model. Assigning a High Risk rating is also supported by other qualitative factors such as S being a recent IPO with a limited public company execution track record, and volatile trading history.
Downside risks to our price target include:

1) High multiple = high beta - investor sensitivity to high multiple stocks driving a rotation to value could bring indiscriminate valuation compression 
2) transformative M&A - the company expanded its corporate development bench in Sep'21 with the appointment of Rob Salvagno to lead M&A and strategic investments (history of tech M&A expertise at financial sponsor and tech companies). Recent press reports noting appetite for \(\sim \Phi 2 - 3B\) deals, which equates to \(\sim 20\%\) of the current market cap, could stoke "core business health" fears and contribute to a de-rating 
3) heavy operating and FCF losses - lack of profitability expected to persist through FY26 (CY25) and low evidence of visible operating leverage constraining valuation support could gate a multiple re-rating in a rising interest rate environment 
4) Competitive landscape is winnowing but more intense with larger, deeper-pocketed players - most specialist challengers have been swept out of the market in the last 3 years for a combined \(\sim \Phi 4B\) , which leaves a less crowded but a more fierce marketplace dynamic, especially with close rivals \(\sim 4x\) bigger.
Upside risks to our price target include:

1) Faster uptake of modules ramps dollar net retention rates and aggregate growth - S's \(20+\) modules have low penetration in the installed base, where improved cross-sell rigor could sustain current \(\sim 130\%\) net expansion rates and buttress ARR growth ahead of our expectations 
2) MSSP traction inflects internationally - a unique aspect of S's GTM is the OEM opportunity with managed security services providers, which can white-label and generate revenue off S' technology backbone. S has significant North American MSSP mindshare, and replicating this strategy internationally could also help deliver outsized levels of profitable growth ahead of our expectations 
3) Becomes a meaningful contender in XDR - S launched its Singularity-branded extended detection & response (XDR) platform in 1H20 and bolstered this via the Feb'21 Sclary acquisition, to enable telemetry ingestion beyond the endpoint. Now a veritable XDR platform, S can commercialize this solution in a market that is still in early innings.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "–" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned

to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
